intro: Lippia recolletae var. pickelii, commonly known as Pickel's lippia, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in desert scrub habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
